alert.note: Alert for Dorchester; Inland Berkeley (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 12:25PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CHARLESTON, BERKELEY AND DORCHESTER COUNTIES... ...MARINERS ON LAKE MOULTRIE AND EASTERN LAKE MARION SHOULD SEEK SAFE HARBOR... At 1225 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Eastern Lake Marion to 6 miles north of Ridgeville to near Givhans, and moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of these storms include... North Charleston, Summerville, Goose Creek, Moncks Corner, Ladson, Ridgeville, Bonneau, and Givhans. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Boaters on Lake Moultrie and the eastern portions of Lake Marion should seek safe harbor immediately. If caught on the open water, stay as low as possible and wear a personal flotation device. Remember, if you can hear thunder you are at risk for being struck by lightning.
